answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found a number of sample catastrophic leave policies from different states for you to review.
Gulfport, MS:
http://www.ci.gulfport.ms.us/HR/hr_forms/DonatedLeavePacket.pdf
San Mateo, CA:
http://www.co.sanmateo.ca.us/portal/site/HR/menuitem.17b74004c666b1da1eefb984e17332a0/?vgnextoid=d28d07a1df2c8110VgnVCM1000001937230aRCRD
Alexander, NC:
http://www.co.alexander.nc.us/share-pool-leave.php
Lincoln, NE:
http://lincoln.ne.gov/city/person/county/ppbcat.pdf
Mendocino, CA:
www.co.mendocino.ca.us/hr/pdf/Policy%2039.pdf 
I also found examples from universities which may be helpful as well.
University of California San Francisco: 
http://ucsfhr.ucsf.edu/index.php/policies/article/voluntary-catastrophic-leave-sharing-program/
Iowa State University:
http://policy.iastate.edu/policy/illness/
West Virginia University:
http://eberly.wvu.edu/r/download/13168 
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An AZ city is looking for copies of catastrophic leave policies that cover employee’s donating leave (sick, vacation, or comp time) to other employees to help them if they are dealing with catastrophic illness for themselves or their family.
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
